Contents: The latest breaking transfer news and all the best rumours...

Content_title: Liverpool book place in final as three goals in second-half recovery sinks plucky Villarreal
Contents: Champions League semi-final second leg, Estadio de la Ceramica – Villarreal CF 2 (Dia 3’, Coquelin 40’) Liverpool 3 (Fabinho 61’, Diaz 67’, Mane 74’) Liverpool win 5-2 on aggregate.

Content_title: ‘We took the game by the scruff of the neck’ - Trent Alexander-Arnold celebrates Liverpool Champions League comeback
Contents: At half time against Villarreal on Tuesday night in the second leg of the Champions League semi-final tie, Liverpool were being held 2-2 on aggregate. They finished 5-2 winners and defender Trent Alexander-Arnold explained that his side’s determination was at the heart of their impressive comeback win.

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp: Coaches 'couldn't find one' example of Liverpool following tactical instructions against Villarreal
Contents: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp saw his side struggle against Villarreal in the first half of the second leg of their Champions League tie on Tuesday. Klopp said he asked his assistant manager Peter Krawietz to find a video clip of the side playing as he wanted at half time, but he was unable to find a single example.

Content_title: Declan Rice, Richarlison and Antony  - three players to rebuild Manchester United after summer transfer window exodus
Contents: Manchester United are set to lose a huge chunk of their first team squad on a free transfer this summer. Juan Mata, Nemanja Matic, Edinson Cavani, Jesse Lingard and Lee Grant are all expected to depart, and that puts pressure on Erik ten Hag to bring in the right players. We look at three potential options.

Content_title: Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich stakes claim to £1.6bn lent to club ahead of proposed takeover - reports
Contents: Chelsea have endured a difficult 2022 after the club and its owner Roman Abramovich were hit by sanctions following the oligarch's associate, Russian president Vladimir Putin, launching an invasion of Ukraine. Now it appears that the billionaire has set up a late obstacle after a preferred bidder was designated.

Content_title: Juan Mata gets the embarrassing but essential Man Utd farewell tour treatment at Old Trafford – The Warm-Up
Contents: So long, Juan Mata. Cya, Nemanja Matic. Ciao, Edinson Cavani. It was fun while it lasted, although this farewell was an essential part of the Manchester United overhaul that will soon take place. It’s just a shame, as far as the fans should be concerned, that the 36th Premier League match of the season was used to say goodbyes, rather than compete for positions in the table.

Content_title: David Brooks of AFC Bournemouth and Wales shares that he is cancer free and is cleared to continue playing football
Contents: The 24-year-old had made 89 appearences for Bournemouth before finding out that he had been diagnosed with Stage 2 Hodgkin lymphoma. On his personal Twitter today, he announced the good news that he has fully recovered, and is set to start training again soon.

Content_title: 'They are your standouts' - Crouch tips Liverpool duo Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane for Ballon d'Or glory
Contents: Peter Crouch says that Sadio Mane, who has international and domestic success this season, should be a favourite for the Ballon d'Or, with Mohamed Salah right behind him if Liverpool manage to win the quadruple this season. The award of the Ballon d’Or is due to take place in October 2022 and this year the prize will be presented on a seasonal basis rather than for a calendar year.

Content_title: ‘Deserved the Ballon d’Or!’ – Javi Martinez reveals why Robert Lewandowski wants Barcelona move
Contents: Robert Lewandowski has been at Bayern Munich since 2014 and has been crucial to their success. However, Lewandowski has yet to win the Ballon d'Or. Former team-mate Javi Martinez has said that the Polish striker is looking for a move to Barcelona to better his chances of winning the French Football award.

Content_title: 'We have made a deal' - Confusion reigns over Fabio Carvalho's future at Fulham amid links to Liverpool
Contents: Fabio Carvalho has been heavily linked to Liverpool, yet the youngster is keen to keep his future plans under wraps, saying that nothing has been decided. Unfortunately for him, Fulham's co-owner may have let it slip that the player has already been sold. Tony Khan said: "We have made a deal that is best for the club and, since that agreement, it’s worked out wonderfully."

Content_title: 'After Real I'll probably stop' - Carlo Ancelotti likely to retire from club coaching after Madrid stint
Contents: Carlo Ancelotti has said that he wants to spend time with family, and travel the world, which means that he likely sees Real Madrid as his last club. He has put no timeline on when he'll leave the club, but admits that after taking some time off, he sees himself taking on an international challenge.

Content_title: Lautaro Martinez: Arsenal to rival Man Utd for Inter striker with Champions League a potential factor – Paper Round
Contents: Tuesday’s Paper Round leads on The Times’ report regarding Arsenal and their interest in Lautaro Martinez, the Inter striker who is also wanted by Manchester United. Elsewhere, Kalvin Phillips must wait for a new deal at Leeds, Sergej Milinkovic-Savic makes the gossip columns again, and a Derby youngster is wanted by a handful of Premier League clubs.

Content_title: 'I would be really angry' - Jurgen Klopp denies Liverpool complacency ahead of Villarreal Champions League second leg
Contents: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp saw his side win a testing match at St James' Park on Saturday as they beat Newcastle 1-0 with a determined performance. He said that the commitment shown at the weekend could help them as they guard against complacency in their Champions League semi-final with Villarreal.

Content_title: Manchester United 3-0 Brentford: Cristiano Ronaldo and Bruno Fernandes on target as hosts ease past Bees
Contents: Premier League, Old Trafford - Manchester United 3 (Fernandes, 9', Ronaldo, 61' (P), Varane, 72') Brentford 0

Content_title: Eintracht Frankfurt lose to Bayer Leverkusen, Leipzig suffer Borussia Monchengladbach defeat
Contents: Eintracht Frankfurt and RB Leipzig both need to avoid defeat in their Europa League semi-final second legs on Thursday to reach the tournament final, but they suffered defeats in the Bundesliga on Monday evening. Leipzig lost to Borussia Monchengladbach and Bayer Leverkusen defeated Eintracht Frankfurt.

Content_title: Flares, saves and fireworks: The Premier League's Manic May kicks off with a bang - The Warm-Up
Contents: A huge win for Everton threw a cat among the Premier League relegation battle pigeons, while Arsenal and Tottenham are heading for that conveniently timed derby to decide fourth place in the table. Elsewhere, an unreal free-kick in the FA Women's Championship, and league title joy in Turkey (and Spain).

Content_title: UEFA extends Russia exclusion to Women's Euro 2022 finals, 2023 competitions and Euro Championship bids
Contents: In response to the ongoing invasion by Russia of Ukraine, European football's governing body UEFA has confirmed its sanctions on Russian sporting involvement. Clubs and national teams representing Russia for the rest of the 2022 footballing calendar, 2022/23 season involvement, and bids for the next two European Championships, have been banned.

Contents: The latest breaking transfer news and all the best rumours...

Content_title: Premier League done deals: All the summer transfer window ins and outs
Contents: Club-by-club details on all the transfer deals across the 2020 summer transfer window in the Premier League.

Content_title: Eric Dier caught short, Gareth Bale excited, that Carabao really is something - The Warm-Up
Contents: Tottenham’s Eric Dier was caught short during his side’s penalty shootout victory over Chelsea in the Carabao Cup. Jose Mourinho didn’t seem to mind after all. There’s been a signing in Manchester, but for City not United. And down in the National League Macclesfield Town have been expelled, a worry sign of things to come lower down the leagues.

Content_title: Jadon Sancho willing to wait until 2021 for Manchester United transfer - Paper Round
Contents: Manchester United are set to make a new bid for Jadon Sancho, but the Borussia Dortmund winger is happy to wait until 2021 for his Old Trafford move. Elsewhere, Manchester City are desperate for new defenders following their 5-2 defeat to Leicester City on Sunday and Tottenham turn to a fierce London rival for a defensive addition. It's Wednesday's Paper Round...

Content_title: Real Madrid don't need any more players, says Zinedine Zidane
Contents: Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane has no interest in bringing in any more players before the transfer window closes next week, he said on Tuesday. Zidane also dismissed that Eden Hazard, who reportedly returned to pre-season training overweight, is unprofessional.

Content_title: Manchester United make £12m bid for Alex Telles - Paper Round
Contents: Manchester United bid £12 million for Porto defender Alex Telles, Newcastle take Florent Indalecio on trial, Mesut Ozil loses his squad number in anticipation of Houssem Aouar, and Ruben Loftus-Cheek may leave Chelsea on loan.

Content_title: Kylian Mbappe: Real Madrid to move for 'chosen one' in 2021
Contents: Kylian Mbappe will replace Luka Jovic as Real Madrid’s No.9 in 2021, club sources have told Eurosport Spain. Jovic only joined the club during the 2019 summer transfer window but it’s been confirmed that Mbappe is their longer-term target.

Content_title: Jack Grealish inspires Aston Villa as Fulham fall to third straight defeat
Contents: Premier League – Craven Cottage – Fulham 0 Aston Villa 3 (Grealish 4, Hourihane 15’, Mings 48’)

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp to Roy Keane: ‘Did you say Liverpool were sloppy tonight?’
Contents: “Did I hear right that Mr Keane said we had a sloppy performance tonight?” Klopp asked after tuning into the Sky Sports studio following Liverpool's 3-1 win over Arsenal. Roy Keane had called the Premier League champions 'machines' but also said there were errors. Klopp said his side were 'absolutely exceptional'.

Content_title: Kepa Arrizabalaga has not played his last game for Chelsea, says Frank Lampard
Contents: With new signing Edouard Mendy ready to make his debut, Frank Lampard launched an impassioned defence of under-fire goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, saying the Spaniard still has a future at Chelsea.

Content_title: Thiago Silva: God helped me chose Chelsea, they are the best in England
Contents: We all need some divine intervention from time to time, with Thiago Silva no different, as he revealed he got a little help when deciding whether to join Chelsea, who the Brazilian believes are the "best in England".

Content_title: 'See what next year brings' - Chelsea's German forward Kai Havertz hopes to one day lift Ballon d'Or
Contents: Chelsea forward Kai Havertz surprised a young fan of his club as part of the Premier League's marketing drive, and was asked if he would one day win the Ballon d'Or, perhaps the greatest individual honour in football. Reluctant to offer any certainty, he instead said that he may be able to win it at some point in the future.

Content_title: Mino Raiola dies aged 54
Contents: The family of football agent Mino Raiola have announced his death aged 54. "In infinite sorrow, we share the passing of the most caring and amazing football agent that ever was,” read a statement released by his family on social media on Saturday. His clients included Erling Haaland, Paul Pogba and Zlatan Ibrahimovic.

Content_title: Roy Keane slams Nemanja Matic after he says goodbye to Manchester United in post-match interview
Contents: Matic is leaving Old Trafford at the end of the season, and used his post match interview to share his affection for the club saying they "will stay forever in my heart". Former United captain Roy Keane was left furious with the comments, accusing manager Ralf Rangnick of allowing a "testimonial" mentality to run through the club as their season comes towards a disappointing end.

Content_title: Erik ten Hag needs to clear out any doubters this summer or face Manchester United failure
Contents: After reports emerged that players at Manchester United already have doubts over their incoming manager, Ajax's Erik ten Hag, it is clear that the Dutchman cannot look for continuity when he arrives. Paul Pogba will be out the door, but it might be that Ten Hag has to get rid of even the players who are content to stay on.

Content_title: Transfers, coaching, Ronaldo, Maguire and Pogba are just the tip of the iceberg for Erik ten Hag at Manchester United
Contents: Reports suggest that Erik ten Hag could be confirmed as the replacement for Ralf Rangnick at Manchester United in the next few days, but despite the glamour and renown of the Premier League side, he faces an almost impossible list of tasks to attack and address if he wants to keep his job, and make a success of life at Old Trafford.

Content_title: Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel says 'I never feel safe' after defeat to Everton threatens top-three finish
Contents: Chelsea suffered a 1-0 defeat to Everton on Sunday afternoon in the Premier League which, following on from their 1-1 draw with Manchester United in midweek, puts their top-three position under threat. Both Thomas Tuchel and Frank Lampard confessed they were starting to feel the pressure with a handful of games remaining.

Content_title: Former Walt Disney chief Bob Iger invited to join private equity group to take over Chelsea
Contents: Following the sanctioning of Chelsea's oligarch owner Roman Abramovich - who denied links to Vladimir Putin only to turn up with his blessing at talks with Ukrainian representatives - there is a bidding war for the London club. There are reports that former Disney head Bob Iger has been invited to join one of the consortiums.

Content_title: Ralf Rangnick takes Austria job, will juggle with Manchester United consultancy role in bid to make club 'real force'
Contents: The move will inevitably raise questions about Ralf Rangnick’s commitment to Manchester United, who he was parachuted in to lead as interim manager after Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s dismissal in November. Rangnick, who has penned a deal until 2024 with Austria, will move into a consultancy role at the end of the season at Old Trafford. Ajax boss Erik ten Hag takes the United reins this summer.

Content_title: Borussia Dortmund battle with Manchester United to sign Sebastien Haller as Erling Haaland replacement – Paper Round
Contents: Manchester United and Borussia Dortmund are ready to fight over former West Ham United transfer flop Sebastien Haller this summer. Elsewhere, Chelsea have compiled a transfer shortlist to replace the outgoing Antonio Rudiger, Aaron Wan-Bissaka could face a shock summer return to Crystal Palace and Southampton are ready to reject any approaches for club captain James Ward-Prowse.

Content_title: Erik ten Hag: Ralf Rangnick backs 'very good choice' coach to be a success at Manchester United
Contents: Ralf Rangnick has thrown his full support behind Erik ten Hag, who will take over as Manchester United manager in the summer. Rangnick is set to continue at United at the end of his time as interim boss in a consultancy role. When asked about Ten Hag, he said: "I think he would be a good choice and I still believe he will be a very good choice."

Content_title: Wales 2-1 Austria: ‘They should all be ashamed of themselves’ – Gareth Bale hits out at ‘disgusting’ treatment in Spain
Contents: Gareth Bale says he will not waste his time responding to what he calls the ‘disgusting’ treatment he has endured in Spain. The Real Madrid star was referred to as a “parasite” in the Spanish press on the morning of the crunch World Cup qualifying play-off semi-final against Austria at the Cardiff City Stadium. Bale said that "it's a waste of my time, it's just disgusting.”

Content_title: Fulham promoted back to Premier League after beating Preston in Championship as yo-yo run continues
Contents: Fulham have been promoted or relegated over the past five seasons, with the Cottagers on the up again after their 3-0 win over Preston North End on Tuesday night. Aleksandar Mitrovic took his tally in the league to a staggering 40 goals with a brace, with Liverpool-bound Fabio Carvalho also netting. Bournemouth lead the race for the second automatic promotion spot.

Content_title: Wales 2-1 Austria: Gareth Bale brace edges Dragons closer to World Cup qualification for first time since 1958
Contents: World Cup UEFA qualification play-off semi-final, Cardiff City Stadium – Wales 2 (Bale 25', 51') Austria 1 (B Davies 65' OG)

Content_title: FA Cup 2022 - Boreham Wood through to FA Cup fifth round with huge upset win at Bournemouth
Contents: The FA Cup is known for its famous upsets as teams from across the English football pyramid meet in the world's most famous domestic knockout competition. There was another surprise on Sunday night when National League team Boreham Wood FC secured a 1-0 win at Bournemouth, currently fighting for promotion to the Premier League.

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp: Sadio Mane could secure Ballon d'Or if Liverpool win Champions League
Contents: "If you're not Messi or Ronaldo you have to probably win the Champions League, which we haven't done yet." The Reds boss heaped praise on his Senegalese forward following his latest heroics against Villarreal, and believes Mane could be crowned the best player in the world if he helps Liverpool to Europe's biggest prize this season.

Content_title: Mohamed Salah and Sam Kerr named FWA Footballers of the Year after 'breaking records for both club and country'
Contents: Salah is on course to finish the season as the Premier League's top scorer, with hopes of firing his team to the title in the remaining matches of the campaign. His goal involvements have been outstanding, with the Egyptian also topping the list of most assists so far. Kerr's also leading the scoring charts in the Women's Super League, where her Chelsea team are close to retaining their title.

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp delighted as Liverpool overcome 'most difficult of circumstances' against Newcastle
Contents: Having rested five key players, including Mohamed Salah, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp heaped praise on his team as a first half Naby Keita goal was enough to see off the challenge of Newcastle at St James' Park in very tough circumstances as the Reds moved back to the top of the Premier League table.

Content_title: Mesut Ozil,  Rio Ferdinand back Karim Benzema for Ballon d'Or after two goals for Real Madrid against Man City
Contents: Karim Benzema has been in brilliant form this season and took his tally to 41 goals in 41 appearances with two efforts in Real Madrid's 4-3 Champions League semi-final first-leg defeat to Manchester City. Benzema, 34, looks to be one of the favourites to win the 2022 Ballon d'Or and his former team-mate Mesut Ozil, as well as Rio Ferdinand, have backed him for the prize.

Content_title: 'The situation is not that easy for me' - Robert Lewandowski unsure about his Bayern Munich future
Contents: Robert Lewandowski's contract is due to expire next summer. He says 'the situation is not that easy for me' when asked about his Bayern Munich future amid rumours he could be heading for Barcelona in the summer transfer window. Bayern's hierarchy say Lewandowski will get a new contract and he is not going anywhere.

Content_title: Robert Lewandowski transfer from Bayern Munich to Barcelona a possibility, but no deal agreed yet
Contents: Bayern will only let Robert Lewandowski leave should they find an adequate replacement. The striker has continued his sensational goalscoring form this season after netting 46 goals in 40 matches across all competitions. His consistent deadly form in front of goal has seen the Pole win the Best FIFA Men’s Player award in 2020 and 2021.

Content_title: Ballon d'Or: Real Madrid president Florentino Perez says 'no doubt' Karim Benzema should win award
Contents: Karim Benzema scored his 26th league goal of the season as Real swept aside Espanyol 4-0 to seal this year's La Liga title. The Frenchman also has 14 goals in the Champions League as Madrid look to overturn a 4-3 semi-final first leg defeat to Manchester City when they welcome the Blues to the Bernabeu this week.

Content_title: ‘No more excuses’ – What Villarreal loss means for Bayern Munich and Julian Nagelsmann
Contents: A 2-1 aggregate loss to Spanish side Villarreal saw 2020 winners Bayern Munich exit the Champions League at the quarter-final stage. Despite it being his first season in charge at the club, it's still a disappointing show from Julian Nagelsmann, who promised much when he touched down in Bavaria. Eurosport Germany's Marc Hlusiak assess what this all means for the manager going forward.

Content_title: Liverpool's deal for Fulham's teenage Portuguese midfielder Fabio Carvalho is 'close' - report
Contents: Having been moments away from a transfer in January, a five-year contract taking19-year-old Fabio Carvalho to Anfield from Championship leaders Fulham is reportedly near to being completed. Carvalho - who recently made his debut for Portugal's under-21 team - has attracted attention with his displays since bursting into the first team at Craven Cottage.

Content_title: Real win 35th title as Rodrygo, Karim Benzema star in four-goal win over Espanyol
Contents: Liga, Bernabéu - Real Madrid 4 (Rodrygo, 33', 43', Asensio, 55', Benzema, 80')  Espanyol 0

Content_title: Karim Benzema: Mental confidence key to Panenka penalty in Real Madrid's Champions League clash with Man City
Contents: Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema showed nerves of steel as he chipped a Panenka penalty down the middle of the goal in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final against Manchester City. The penalty means Real only lost the match 4-3 ahead of the second leg at the Bernabeu and Benzema, who has enhanced his Ballon d'Or claim further, says he has confidence in himself.

Content_title: Manchester City 4-3 Real Madrid: Los Blancos are a Champions League force of nature - The Warm-Up
Contents: Real Madrid show their Champions League pedigree to somehow defy Manchester City and head to the Bernabeu with - remarkably - a suggestion of the initiative. Carlo Ancelotti has revealed the moment he felt trust was broken with PSG and Barcelona's social media manager wants nothing to do with a Cristiano Ronaldo celebration.

Content_title: Carlo Ancelotti: ‘Magic’ of the Bernabeu helped Real Madrid ‘never surrender’ against Chelsea in Champions League
Contents: Real Madrid progressed to the Champions League semi-finals despite a huge scare against Chelsea at the Bernabeu. The Liga giants led 3-1 after the first leg at Stamford Bridge but fell 3-0 behind in the return fixture as they stared down a humiliating exit. However, goals from Rodrygo and Karim Benzema ensured Real stayed on course for a record-extending 14th Champions League crown.

Content_title: 'He had a significant injury' - Mikel Arteta fears Thomas Partey will not play again for Arsenal this season
Contents: Thomas Partey has emerged as a vital figure for Arsenal this term, but Gunners boss Mikel Arteta confirmed the Ghana international midfielder is unlikely to play again this season. The former Atletico Madrid man picked up a thigh injury in the loss to Crystal Palace earlier in April and could miss the final five games of the Premier League season.

Content_title: Mino Raiola: Agent of Erling Haaland and Paul Pogba says health status is 'p***** off' after death reports
Contents: Italian football agent Mino Raiola has clients including Erling Haaland, Paul Pogba and Zlatan Ibrahimovic. Widespread reports in Italy and beyond said he had died on Thursday and Real Madrid even tweeted their condolences. However, Raiola hit out at the reports via a post on Twitter.

Content_title: 'He's got my phone number' - Manchester United interim boss Ralf Rangnick says Erik ten Hag can call him anytime
Contents: Ralf Rangnick believes newly-appointed Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag can be a success at the club and says he can phone him whenever he needs advice. Rangnick believes that players brought into Manchester United from now on must "really fit and are able to meet the standards of this big club" if they are to rise up the Premier League table.

Content_title: Transfer news and update: RB Leipzig confirm Dominik Szoboszlai capture from Red Bull Salzburg
Contents: RB Leipzig have won the race to sign 20-year-old Hungarian rising star Dominik Szoboszlai from Red Bull Salzburg. Szoboszlai has signed a contract until the summer of 2025 with the German side, who have very frequently raided the Austrian club for new signings thanks to the close links between the two.

Content_title: RB Leipzig's Julian Nagelsmann says semi meet-up with mentor PSG boss Thomas Tuchel was unimaginable
Contents: When Paris Saint-Germain face RB Leipzig in their Champions League semi-final on Tuesday, it will mark a fascinating crossing of paths for two of Germany's brightest coaches.

Content_title: Football news - RB Leipzig chief says Timo Werner's Chelsea move is not done yet
Contents: RB Leipzig chief executive Oliver Mintzlaff has denied that Chelsea have already sealed a move for Timo Werner.

Content_title: Chelsea could lose Mason Mount and Christian Pulisic this summer as Juventus lurk - Paper Round
Contents: Chelsea midfield pair Christian Pulisic and Mason Mount could both potentially leave Stamford Bridge this summer with the American on the sidelines and Mount unable to sign a new deal. Elsewhere, Arsenal are set to watch Renato Sanches join AC Milan, and Manchester United may pay Anthony Martial to leave.

Content_title: Premier League result - Richarlison grabs winner as Everton claim crucial win over Chelsea
Contents: Premier League, Goodison Park - Everton 1 (Richarlison 56') Chelsea 0

Content_title: WSL results: Arsenal beat Aston Villa to keep pressure on Chelsea, as Blues secure win at Birmingham
Contents: After Manchester City's comprehensive win over Brighton, United had to respond and did so with a straightforward win over West Ham. Later on Sunday, Arsenal crushed Aston Villa 7-0 to keep the pressure up on league leaders Chelsea, and Leicester City shared the points with a goalless draw at home with Reading.

Content_title: Chelsea must view Manchester United's decline as a warning as they prepare for Roman Abramovich exit
Contents: Manchester United have suffered a remarkable and close to catastrophic decline since the departure of Alex Ferguson and David Gill. Ed Woodward presided over one mistake after another, and the club's struggles should serve as a warning to Chelsea as they prepare for the sale of the club by Roman Abramovich.

Content_title: Thomas Tuchel sad to see Antonio Rudiger leave Chelsea with Real Madrid transfer expected in summer
Contents: Chelsea look set to lose defender Antonio Rudiger this summer as he is reportedly going to join Real Madrid when his contract expires. Rudiger, 29, has been a key player under Thomas Tuchel, who is not happy to see the German international leave. Rudiger could be available for Chelsea when they face Manchester United in the Premier League on Thursday.

Content_title: Arsenal confirm Willian capture from Chelsea
Contents: Arsenal have confirmed the signing of Willian on a free transfer from London rivals Chelsea on a three-year deal in their first major transfer market foray this summer.

Content_title: Pablo Mari and Cedric Soares sign permanent deals with Arsenal
Contents: Arsenal have agreed permanent deals with defenders Pablo Mari and Cedric Soares after their loan spells in the second half of the 2019-20 season.

Content_title: Arsenal sign Gabriel Magalhaes from Lille
Contents: The 22-year-old defender has joined in a deal reported to be worth £27m.

Content_title: Arsenal agree Dani Ceballos loan from Real Madrid
Contents: Dani Ceballos will return to Arsenal on loan from Real Madrid for a second season.

Content_title: Arsenal sign goalkeeper Alex Runarsson on four-year deal from Dijon
Contents: Goalkeeper Alex Runarsson fills the void left by Emiliano Martinez at Arsenal after joining on a four-year deal from Dijon. Martinez left last week to sign for Aston Villa and Runarrson is likely to be back-up for Arsenal No 1 Bernd Leno.

Content_title: Arsenal beat deadline to sign Thomas Partey, Lucas Torreira goes to Atletico Madrid
Contents: Arsenal confirmed the signing of Thomas Partey from Atletico Madrid after the London club activated the midfielder’s €50 million release clause. The club had been linked with Lyon playmaker Houssem Aouar but after that fell through Mikel Arteta appears turned his attentions to the Ghanaian 27-year-old.

Content_title: Emiliano Martinez joins Aston Villa from Arsenal after ten years at the Gunners
Contents: Emiliano Martinez has joined Aston Villa from Arsenal on a four-year deal. During his time with the north London club, he has had loan spells at Oxford United, Sheffield Wednesday, Rotherham United, Wolves, Getafe and Reading.

Content_title: Aston Villa splash out on Brentford striker Ollie Watkins
Contents: Ollie Watkins, the Championship's top marksman last season, has reunited with former Brentford manager Dean Smith at Aston Villa for the upcoming Premier League season.

Content_title: Bertrand Traore to Aston Villa: Ex-Chelsea forward completes move from Lyon
Contents: Traore's signing follows the arrival of goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez from Arsenal and striker Ollie Watkins from Championship side Brentford. The Chelsea academy player was already well known by Villa assistant John Terry.

Content_title: Brighton complete Adam Lallana signing from Liverpool
Contents: Adam Lallana has swapped Liverpool for Brighton after signing a three-year contract with the south-coast club.

Content_title: Brighton snap up Joel Veltman from Ajax
Contents: Brighton and Hove Albion have confirmed the signing of defender Joel Veltman from Ajax for an undisclosed fee.

Content_title: Joe Hart joins Tottenham on a free transfer after release from Burnley
Contents: Former England goalkeeper Joe Hart has joined Tottenham Hotspur on a free transfer on a two-year deal following his release from Burnley.

Content_title: Football news - Chelsea confirm Hakim Ziyech will join from Ajax in the summer
Contents: Chelsea have confirmed that Ajax midfielder Hakim Ziyech will join them in the summer.

Content_title: Chelsea complete £47.5m Timo Werner signing
Contents: Chelsea have completed the signing of Timo Werner from RB Leipzig on a five-year deal for an unconfirmed fee believed to be £47.5m.

Content_title: Chelsea complete Ben Chilwell signing from Leicester City
Contents: Chelsea have added another player with the arrival of England international Ben Chilwell.

Content_title: Malang Sarr joins Chelsea on five-year deal, immediately goes out on loan
Contents: Malang Sarr becomes Chelsea's fourth major signing of the summer as Frank Lampard continues his rebuild.

Content_title: Thiago Silva joins Chelsea on a free transfer, signing a one-year deal
Contents: Silva left Paris Saint-Germain after eight years following the club's Champions League final defeat to Bayern Munich.

Content_title: Chelsea sign Kai Havertz to continue bumper summer
Contents: It’s taken a while but Kai Havertz is finally a Chelsea player.

Content_title: Chelsea confirm signing of goalkeeper Edouard Mendy on a five-year deal
Contents: It was the news under-fire Kepa Arrizabalaga has been fearing, but Chelsea have confirmed the signing of Edouard Mendy from Rennes for an undisclosed fee, with the goalkeeper penning a five-year deal.

Content_title: Highly-rated Eberechi Eze completes £20m Crystal Palace move
Contents: Eze won QPR's Supporters’ Player of the Year, Players’ Player of the Year and Junior Hoops Player of the Year awards last season

Content_title: Everton complete signing of Allan from Napoli
Contents: The 29-year-old reunites with Carlo Ancelotti, who managed him at Napoli.

Content_title: Everton announce James Rodriguez swoop
Contents: James Rodriguez arrives at Everton from Real Madrid for a reported £20 million

Content_title: Everton agree £25m Abdoulaye Doucoure deal
Contents: Abdoulaye Doucoure will join Allan as one of Everton's new signings, with James Rodriguez expected to undergo a medical on Thursday.

Content_title: Leeds sign Jack Harrison on loan from Man City and Joe Gelhardt from Wigan
Contents: Leeds United have re-signed English winger Jack Harrison from Manchester City on a season-long loan deal.

Content_title: Leeds United further bolster defence with capture of Diego Llorente from Sociedad
Contents: It has been a very productive transfer window for the Premier League newboys so far but Leeds United have further bolstered their defensive options with the capture of Diego Llorente from Real Sociedad.

Content_title: Liverpool sign left-back Kostas Tsimikas from Olympiacos
Contents: Premier League champions Liverpool have announced the signing of Kostas Tsimikas on a long-term contract from Olympiacos.

Content_title: Liverpool complete Thiago signing from Bayern on a four year deal
Contents: The deal looked dead in the water, with Jurgen Klopp even dismissing talk of a move as "speculation" but, at long last, Thiago Alcantara has agreed to sign for Liverpool in a €30m deal after talks with Bayern Munich progressed rapidly this week.

Content_title: Liverpool sign Portugal winger Diogo Jota from Wolves
Contents: Liverpool have signed Diogo Jota from Wolverhampton Wanderers with the 23-year-old Portuguese international forward the champions' second signing in quick succession after Thiago Alcantara arrived on Friday from Bayern Munich.

Content_title: Dejan Lovren joins FC Zenit from Liverpool
Contents: Dejan Lovren has joined FC Zenit after leaving Premier League champions Liverpool.

Content_title: Wolves confirm Ki-Jana Hoever signing from Liverpool
Contents: Wolves have announced the signing of 18-year-old Dutch defender Ki-Jana Hoever from Premier League champions Liverpool for a fee thought to be worth around £10 million. Diogo Jota is set to move in the opposite direction.

Content_title: Manchester City clinch signing of Ferran Torres
Contents: Manchester City have completed the signing of Ferran Torres from Valencia.

Content_title: Manchester City confirm Nathan Ake signing
Contents: Manchester City have confirmed the capture of Nathan Ake from Bournemouth for a fee believed be worth up to £41 million.

Content_title: Manchester City confirm Ruben Dias signing, with Nicolas Otamendi joining Benfica as part of deal
Contents: Manchester City have signed Ruben Dias from Benfica, with Nicolas Otamendi heading in the other direction as part of the deal. The 23-year-old is reported to have cost £62m and becomes City's third summer signing after Ferran Torres and Nathan Ake.

Content_title: Leroy Sane completes Bayern Munich move
Contents: Leroy Sane has completed his much-anticipated move from Manchester City to Bayern Munich.

Content_title: Former Man City midfielder David Silva signs for Real Sociedad
Contents: Former Manchester City midfielder David Silva has signed for La Liga side Real Sociedad after he left the English club.

Content_title: Manchester United confirm Donny van de Beek signing from Ajax
Contents: Manchester United have finally confirmed the Dutchman's arrival.

Content_title: Man United agree deal to sign teenage winger Amad Diallo Traore
Contents: Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign Atalanta forward Amad Diallo Traoré. The winger has played just 25 minutes of Serie A football but is regarded as an exceptional prospect, and United may have to spend around £40 million should he be a success at Old Trafford.

Content_title: Alex Telles: Manchester United sign Porto left-back
Contents: Manchester United have signed Porto left-back Alex Telles, the Premier League club have announced. The Brazil international has signed a contract until 2024, with an option for a further year. The Old Trafford club are also said to be closing in on a deal for Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani, who is available on a free after leaving PSG.

Content_title: Manchester United confirm Edinson Cavani deal in late flurry of activity
Contents: Former Paris Saint-Germain striker Edinson Cavani has joined Manchester United on a permanent deal after failing to find another club in the transfer window. The 33-year-old Uruguayan international is set to offer support to Anthony Martial and Odion Ighalo in attack.

Content_title: Alexis Sanchez leaves Manchester United for Inter Milan on a three-year deal
Contents: Alexis Sanchez has joined Inter Milan from Manchester United on a three-year contract, both clubs have announced.

Content_title: Dean Henderson v David de Gea the ‘next chapter’ as Aaron Ramsdale joins Sheff Utd
Contents: Dean Henderson bid farewell to Sheffield United on the same day the Blades confirmed the arrival of Aaron Ramsdale from Bournemouth.

Content_title: Sheffield United announce signing of Rhian Brewster from Liverpool for £23 million
Contents: Sheffield United have broken their transfer record to sign Rhian Brewster from Liverpool. The England under-21 international has reportedly cost around £23 million and Jurgen Klopp's side are believed to have a buyback clause that lasts for the next three years.

Content_title: Tottenham confirm signing of Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg from Southampton
Contents: Tottenham have confirmed the signing of Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg from fellow Premier League side Southampton.

Content_title: Tottenham sign right back Matt Doherty from Wolves
Contents: Jose Mourinho continues a strong transfer window for the club.

Content_title: Gareth Bale completes sensational return to Tottenham
Contents: Gareth Bale has completed a sensational return to Tottenham as Jose Mourinho adds some much-needed firepower to his strikeforce. The Wales international joins the club on a one-year load deal.

Content_title: Tottenham confirm Sergio Reguilon signing from Real Madrid
Contents: Tottenham Hotspur have confirmed the signing of Sergio Reguilón from Real Madrid. The Spain international has signed a deal that runs until 2025 and will wear the number three shirt.

Content_title: West Ham sign Czech midfielder Tomas  Soucek on permanent deal
Contents: West Ham United have signed Czech Republic midfielder Tomas Soucek from Slavia Prague on a four-year contract after a successful loan spell, the Premier League club said on Friday.

Content_title: Wolves smash club record to sign Fabio Silva from Porto
Contents: Wolves have signed the 18-year-old for more than they paid for Raul Jimenez.

Content_title: Nelson Semedo joins Wolves from Barcelona in £37m deal
Contents: Nelson Semedo has joined Wolves in a deal worth around £37m from Barcelona, the La Liga club have announced. The Portugal international is widely expected to replace the departed Matt Doherty in their right wing-back role in the starting XI.

Content_title: Pep Guardiola confirms Ruben Dias out for at least one month, will miss Man City vs Utd derby
Contents: Ruben Dias has been one of the standout performers at the Etihad Stadium since his arrival at Manchester City in September 2020. However, with Saturday's Manchester derby to come, the Portuguese defender will not take part for Pep Guardiola's side as an injury to his hamstring will keep him out for at least four weeks.

Content_title: 'We have to play better' - Jurgen Klopp says Liverpool could have done better in 5-0 win away to Manchester United
Contents: Liverpool’s manager Jurgen Klopp said his side should have played even better in their 5-0 thrashing of Manchester United at Old Trafford. Speaking ahead of the Reds' next game against Brighton, Klopp said they had relied on luck and their goalkeeper, Alisson Becker, to avoid conceding against the Red Devils.

Content_title: 'Jose wasn’t happy but there was nothing I could do!' – Eric Dier on leaving the pitch
Contents: Eric Dier left the pitch in the second half and he explained that when nature calls there’s nothing that can be done. His manager also had a laugh about it but was full of praise for the performance that his player put in after playing twice in 48 hours as Spurs deal with a congested fixture schedule.

Content_title: Mason Mount misses crucial spot-kick as Spurs beat Chelsea on penalties
Contents: EFL Cup Fourth Round, Tottenham Hotspur Stadium – Tottenham Hotspur 1 (Lamela 84’) Chelsea 1 (Werner 19’) Spurs win 5-4 on penalties

Content_title: Liverpool's Thiago Alcantara self-isolating after positive Covid-19 test
Contents: Liverpool have announced that new signing Thiago Alcantara, who missed Monday's win over Arsenal, has tested positive for Covid-19. The club say he is "currently self-isolating according to the necessary guidelines” and has “exhibited minor symptoms of the virus but is in good health and is getting better”.

Content_title: August 10 deadline? Jadon Sancho to Man Utd – What we know so far
Contents: Jadon Sancho’s move to Manchester United appears to be edging closer, although reports on Monday suggest Borussia Dortmund have set a deadline for the transfer - is there a twist in this drawn-out tale?

Content_title: Paul Pogba leaves Man Utd players’ WhatsApp group after confirming exit plans this summer – Paper Round
Contents: Ralf Rangnick admitted Paul Pogba had likely played his last game for Manchester United following an injury against Liverpool, and it would appear the Frenchman is already saying his goodbyes. Elsewhere in Tuesday’s Paper Round, a double dose of Ten Hag reports and claims AC Milan have joined the race for Manchester City forward Riyad Mahrez.

Content_title: Pep Guardiola refuses to discuss Erling Haaland transfer talk and says focus is on Man City’s current season
Contents: Manchester City could complete a move for Erling Haaland this month according to the Daily Mail, with the Premier League leaders agreeing a £500,000-a-week salary with the Norwegian’s representatives. Haaland, who has a 75m euros (£62.3m) release clause at Borussia Dortmund, has been linked with City, Real Madrid, PSG, Barcelona, Chelsea, Man Utd and Bayern Munich this season.

Content_title: Man Utd dressing room split on Erik ten Hag, Real Madrid want to loan out Eden Hazard – Paper Round
Contents: Tuesday’s Paper Round leads on reports Manchester United’s dressing room is split on the possibility of Ajax boss Erik ten Hag taking charge at Old Trafford. There’s also Eden Hazard reportedly being loaned out by Real Madrid next season, Tottenham looking to make Dejan Kulusevski’s move permanent, and news on Kalvin Phillips’ contract at Leeds.

Content_title: Manchester United 'hold talks' with Ismaila Sarr, but it would be a gamble
Contents: Manchester United are interested in signing Ismaila Sarr from Watford, according to reports. Sarr joined Watford for a club-record fee of £30m in August 2019 and is currently playing in the Championship following the Hornets' relegation.

Content_title: Eden Hazard set to miss Chelsea return in Champions League with Real Madrid after undergoing surgery
Contents: Eden Hazard's injury-hit spell at Real Madrid has continued as he has undergone surgery that could rule him out for a month. Hazard, 31, has had a plate removed from his leg and is not expected to be available to face former club Chelsea in the quarter-finals of the Champions League. Hazard has made just 65 appearances for the La Liga leaders after signing in 2019.

Content_title: Arsena face summer transfer battle for Wolves' Ruben Neves and PSV striker Cody Gakpo - Paper Round
Contents: Arsenal hope to sign Ruben Neves from Wolves, while they might find it difficult to secure Cody Gakpo from PSV Eindhoven if he stops playing through the middle to get a World Cup spot with the Netherlands. Elsewhere, Real Madrid may be stuck with Eden Hazard, and Chelsea's preferred bidders are confirmed.

Content_title: 'I have done what I had to do' - Gerard Pique had no hesitation in taking pay reduction to help his Barcelona 'family'
Contents: “I was born and raised here,” Gerard Pique said following the club’s 4-2 win over Real Sociedad. “I have done what I had to do with the wage reduction."  Pique opened the scoring in the 4-2 win on Sunday, and the defender will hope the club can put the issues of the summer behind them and challenge for honours in the post-Messi era.

Content_title: Zinedine Zidane not interested in new Real Madrid transfers
Contents: Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane says he does not want to sign any more players before the transfer window shuts, even after his side looked short on firepower in their 0-0 draw at Real Sociedad in last week's season opener.

Content_title: Controversial Sergio Ramos Panenka seals Real Madrid victory against ten-man Real Betis
Contents: La Liga, Estadio Benito Villamarin – Real Betis 2 (Mandi 35’, Carvalho 37’) Real Madrid 3 (Valverde 14’, Emerson (OG) 48’, Ramos (P) 82’)

Content_title: Memphis Depay among players registered by Barcelona as club legend Gerard Pique takes substantial pay cut
Contents: Barcelona’s summer arrivals are officially available for La Liga action after registration, as the club struggles to deal with a hefty wage bill. Lionel Messi’s departure has helped free up funds, as talks of a salary reduction for Sergio Busquets and Jordi Alba are ongoing, the club confirmed.

Content_title: Real Madrid deny claims club president Florentino Perez wants to quit La Liga for move to Premier League
Contents: Los Blancos boss Florentino Perez has reportedly explored the option of a possible switch to the Premier League after rows between the club and La Liga continue. In an official statement the club have strongly denied any chance of a move and claim rumours are ‘false, absurd and impossible’ as Perez is understood to be furious with La Liga officials.

Content_title: Premier League round-up: Joelinton stars as Newcastle United move into top half, Leicester held by Aston Villa
Contents: Joelinton marked his 100th Premier League start for Newcastle with a first-half brace, setting the Magpies on their way to a 3-0 win against Norwich. Bruno Guimaraes put gloss on an already polished performance with a third to move Eddie Howe's men into ninth, one place ahead of Leicester, who drew 0-0 with Aston Villa at the King Power Stadium.

Content_title: Liverpool ease past Arsenal, new signing Diogo Jota nets debut Reds goal
Contents: Premier League, Anfield - Liverpool 3 (Mane 28', Robertson 34', Jota 88') Arsenal 1 (Lacazette 25')

Content_title: Frank Lampard refuses to discuss Chelsea links, other Premier League managers extend sympathy over Ukraine
Contents: Premier League managers have expressed sympathy over the invasion of Ukraine by Russia, on president Vladimir Putin's orders. Pep Guardiola, Ralf Rangnick and David Moyes all discussed the situation. Manchester City's Oleksandr Zinchenko, West Ham's Andriy Yarmolenko and Everton's Vitalii Mykolenko are all from Ukraine.

Content_title: N'Golo Kante to Manchester United: Could surprise swoop be just what Ole Gunnar Solskjaer needs?
Contents: After Manchester United got away with one, and some, on Saturday at Brighton, the club are looking at ways to strengthen a fragile defence, with Chelsea's N'Golo Kante emerging as a shock option.

Content_title: Chelsea showed spirit but it’s time they showed some common sense
Contents: After watching Chelsea’s chaotic performance against West Bromwich Albion, Pete Sharland wonders when they’re going to wake up and realise what is happening.

Content_title: Tottenham manager Antonio Conte: Premier League defeat to Wolves 'one of the best games we played'
Contents: Despite losing 2-0 to Wolverhampton Wanderers - his side's third consecutive loss - Tottenham manager Antonio Conte was happy with his side's effort and commitment in their Premier League game on Sunday afternoon. However he acknowledged it would take time to turnaround his side's form after months of struggle.

Content_title: Jesse Lingard given time off and will miss Middlesbrough tie, explains Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick
Contents: Manchester United and England forward Jesse Lingard asked Ralf Rangnick for time off following his failure to leave the club in the January transfer window despite interest in the playmaker from various clubs. Club boss Ralf Rangnick gave him the go-ahead to miss the next couple of days and will not face Middlsbrough this Friday.

Content_title: Tammy Abraham strikes late to rescue point for lacklustre Chelsea against West Brom
Contents: Premier League, The Hawthorns – West Bromwich Albion 3 (Robinson 4’, 25’, Bartley 27’) Chelsea 3 (Mount 55’, Hudson-Odoi 70’, Abraham 90+3’)

Content_title: The Champions League road to where? Plus: Kai Havertz shows Romelu Lukaku the Chelsea way – The Warm-Up
Contents: It was dubbed “the road to St Petersburg” but now the Champions League final could be moved from Russia as pressure mounts on UEFA to make the change due to the escalating crisis in eastern Europe. In the meantime, holders Chelsea are looking good to reach the quarter-finals thanks to Kai Havertz, but Juventus have work to do after drawing with Villarreal – despite Dusan Vlahovic’s perfect start.

Content_title: Chelsea 2-0 Lille: Kai Havertz, Christian Pulisic both score in last-16 first leg to seal a comfortable lead
Contents: Champions League Round of 16 first leg, Stamford Bridge - Chelsea 2 (Havertz 8', Pulisic 68') Lille 0

Content_title: Thomas Tuchel explains how Kai Havertz has ‘stepped up’ for Chelsea this season – and what he can do better
Contents: Having scored the winner from the spot in the Club World Cup final against Palmeiras last weekend, Kai Havertz has shown a knack for delivering for Chelsea in the biggest games. While his goal tally still leaves something to be desired, Thomas Tuchel feels that he is on the right track in terms of his overall development.

Content_title: Pep Guardiola set for new Manchester City deal as Erling Haaland arrival imminent - Paper Round
Contents: Manchester City will give Pep Guardiola a new deal as they await Erling Haaland's arrival, while Barcelona could extend Ousmane Dembele's stay at the Nou Camp. Elsewhere, Arsenal could moe for Julian Brandt of Borussia Dortmund, and Erik ten Hag wants Feyenoord defender Tyrell Malacia at Manchester United.

Content_title: 'He would have gone to Manchester United' - Borussia Dortmund chief Hans-Joachim Watzke reveals Erling Haaland history
Contents: Erling Haaland has been an outstanding success at Borussia Dortmund since his transfer from Red Bull Salzburg in 2020, hitting a remarkable 82 goals in just 86 games, but he was almost a Manchester United player, BVB chief Hans-Joachim Watzke has now revealed.

Content_title: Manchester United 1-1 Chelsea: Cristiano Ronaldo cancels out Marcos Alonso strike as points shared at Old Trafford
Contents: Premier League, Old Trafford: Manchester United 1 (Ronaldo 62’), Chelsea 1 (Alonso 60)

Content_title: Cristiano still a 'big help' for United - Ralf Rangnick on Cristiano Ronaldo's possible United future
Contents: "It is Erik's and Cristiano's decision for what he does next but today his performance was really great." United's Interim manager Ralf Rangnick is set to be replaced by Erik Ten Hag in a summer of much expected upheaval at Old Trafford. But while there has been speculation over Ronaldo's future, Rangnick believes he still has a role to play at the club.

Content_title: Manchester United interim boss Ralf Rangnick to be appointed Austria manager - reports
Contents: Ralf Rangnick has been in charge at Old Trafford since the sacking of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer last winter. Rangnick will step aside in the summer when Ajax manager Erik ten Hag arrives at the club and is set to combine a consultancy role at Old Trafford with his new role with Austria.

Content_title: Erik ten Hag confirmed as new Manchester United manager, will join from Ajax in summer
Contents: Manchester United fans needed some good news after their shambolic 4-0 defeat to Liverpool on Tuesday – and they appear to have got it with confirmation Erik ten Hag will arrive from Ajax this summer. The Dutchman is tasked with delivering the first sustained title challenge in the post-Sir Alex Ferguson era, with the club in disarray and a host of star players linked with the Old Trafford exit.

Content_title: ‘We are reaching the Real Madrid zone’ – View from Spain on Champions League semi-final against Manchester City
Contents: The Champions League semi-finals are here and in order to preview the clash between Real Madrid and Manchester City we have gotten in touch with our Spanish office to get all the latest news from the Spanish capital. Who will play on the right hand side of the attack? And who might miss out with injury?

Content_title: ‘The weirdest marriage in recent history’ – View from France on Mauricio Pochettino and Antonio Conte at PSG
Contents: After reports that PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino is due to be dismissed, Pete Sharland gets in touch with Cyril Morin from Eurosport France. Topics covered include whether Pochettino was destined to fail, is the PSG dressing room impossible for anyone to manage, and who will take over from Pochettino?

Content_title: 'Make your Real Madrid dream come true' - French legend Jean-Pierre Papin tells Kylian Mbappe to leave PSG
Contents: “You should never go against your dreams, you have to go. If that's where he wants to go, he has to go." Kylian Mbappe has been told to seize the opportunity to move to the Bernabeu by Jean-Pierre Papin, mirroring his own career after leaving Marseille for AC Milan in 1992. With his contract in Paris up in the summer, Mbappe has been heavily linked with a move to Spain.

Content_title: Manchester United set to appoint Ajax manager Erik ten Hag as Ralf Rangnick replacement in next few days – reports
Contents: Ajax manager Erik ten Hag watched his side lose 2-1 to PSV Eindhoven in the KNVB Cup final at the weekend, which may be the last time he oversees his current side in a knockout competition. Reports suggest that Premier League side Manchester United will appoint him as their new manager in the coming days.

Content_title: Wayne Rooney’s Derby County relegated from Championship after dramatic late defeat at Queens Park Rangers
Contents: Wayne Rooney and his Derby County side have endured a tough season with financial problems and administration costing them 21 points in deductions, with their challenge to stay in the Championship made even harder by a transfer embargo. On Monday their relegation to League One was finally confirmed with defeat at QPR.

Content_title: An excellent weekend for crisis club Chelsea who have made it into two FA Cup finals - The Warm-Up
Contents: Chelsea are a club in crisis apparently. They had a decent weekend. Elsewhere, Tottenham and Arsenal had a horrendous Saturday. PSG and Marseille had their match marred by a lack of away fans and Karim Benzema is excellent at association football, but you knew that already. And who is Saïd Aïgoun?

Content_title: West Ham 1-2 Arsenal: Gunners make Champions League statement with Hammers win
Contents: West Ham United 1 (Bowen, 45')  v Arsenal 2 (Holding, 38', Gabriel, 54') - Premier League LIVE

Content_title: Udinese 1-2 Inter Milan: Nerazzurri keep their Serie A league title dream alive with crucial win
Contents: Serie A, Dacia Arena - Udinese 1 (Pussetto, 72') Inter 2 (Perišic, 11’, Martínez, 39')

Content_title: Arsenal confirm defender Kieran Tierney will miss rest of season ahead of left knee surgery
Contents: Arsenal have been dealt a blow as they attempt to nail down a spot in next season's Champions League tournament. They lost 3-0 to Crystal Palalce on Monday night and on Tuesday confirmed that their Scottish international defender Kieran Tierney is out for the rest of the season as he requires knee surgery.

Content_title: ‘He’ll always try and rocket it!’ – Benfica dangerman Darwin Nunez, the forward everyone wants to sign
Contents: Ahead of their Champions League clash against Liverpool Pete Sharland looks at Benfica forward Darwin Nunez. With the help of Tom Kundert from Portugoal and Aaron Barton of Proxima Jornada, Sharland analyses the strengths and weaknesses of Nunez's game, as well as which team might be the best fit when he eventually moves in the summer.

Content_title: Ballon d’Or 2022 - Lionel Messi, Kylian Mbappe and Robert Lewandowski chances of winning award examined
Contents: This year’s World Cup in Qatar will take place after the presentation of this year’s award, and the players’ exploits in that tournament will be judged for the following year. But despite a number of fundamental for this year's award, the usual suspects are set to battle it out once again to receive what is arguably the most respected individual award in world football.

Content_title: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp hopes Mo Salah and Sadio Mane sign new deals after he committed his future to the club
Contents: With one trophy in the bag and three more to play for before the end of the season, Jurgen Klopp has urged his Liverpool team not let the chance pass by to make new memories at Anfield. After signing a contract extension until 2026, the German is also hopeful Mo Salah and Sadio Mane will follow suit, but admits he's unsure his decision to stay "will be a decisive factor".

Content_title: Benfica 2-2 Ajax: Roman Yaremchuk comes off the bench to score equaliser for hosts against Eredivisie side
Contents: Champions League Round of 16 first leg, Estadio da Luz - Benfica 2 (Haller og 26', Yaremchuk 72') Ajax 2 (Tadic 18', Haller 29')

Content_title: Africa Cup of Nations coverage 'completely tinged with racism' claims Ian Wright ahead of Cameroon tournament
Contents: "Loads of the best players in Europe right now are African. And if we love them at club level, why can’t we love them at international level like their counterparts from across the world? Why can’t we? Why is this tournament constantly getting so much flack?" said Ian Wright in a passionate address on TikTok. The AFCON finals kick off on January 9 in Cameroon.

Content_title: Football news - FC Sheriff beat Shakhtar Donetsk in Champions League debut, Sebastien Haller scores four for Ajax
Contents: Moldovan club FC Sheriff won the first Champions League in their history as they beat Shakhtar Donetsk. Adama Traore opened the scoring in the 16th minute and Momo Yansane scored a second to clinch the three points. Sheriff are in Group D along with La Liga side Real Madrid and Serie A champions Inter Milan.

Content_title: Erik ten Hag and the Manchester United job that is probably impossible – The Warm-Up
Contents: You might have heard that Manchester United have a new manager. Some guy called Erik. Does he knows exactly what he's let himself in for? Or is that perhaps the point? And... no Sean Dyche? No problem! Against all logic, Burnley are suddenly playing well, creating chances and scoring goals, and once again they're breathing down Everton's neck.

Content_title: 'He will blow your mind!' - How 'awkward' Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag transformed Ajax
Contents: "He wants players to be able to adapt and for sure he is a tactical genius, much more than Ole Gunnar Solskjaer or Frank Lampard for instance who faced a bit of the same problem." Eurosport's Kevin van Nunen gives the lowdown on Erik ten Hag and exactly what he can do at Manchester United. Ten Hag will arrive at Old Trafford this summer after penning a three-year deal, with the option of a fourth.

Content_title: Casemiro on Gareth Bale boos: When you whistle a player like that, you're whistling the history of Real Madrid
Contents: Gareth Bale has often been the subject of jeers from his own supporters at Real Madrid. The Welshman received a negative reception at the Bernabeu on the weekend after coming on as a substitute in their 2-0 win over Getafe. Bale was recently called a “parasite” in the newspaper Marca after he was absent for the Clasico defeat before starting for Wales four days later.

Content_title: ‘It’s too early’ – Roberto Mancini 'too disappointed' to discuss future after North Macedonia loss
Contents: Italy have failed to qualify for the last two editions of the World Cup after their loss to North Macedonia in their World Cup qualification play-off semi-final, and manager Roberto Mancini says he is 'too disappointed' to discuss his future. The Azzurri won the World Cup in 2006 but were knocked out at the group stage in 2010 and 2014 and have failed to qualify for 2018 and 2022.

Content_title: Gareth Bale achieves absolute perfection, Italy are out of the 2022 World Cup again! - The Warm-Up
Contents: Wales are one game away from the 2022 World Cup finals thanks to two majestic Gareth Bale goals and an admirable team performance. And we need to seriously consider if the first goal, the free-kick, is the greatest of all time. Elsewhere, Italy are out! It turns out goalscoring is actually quite difficult.

Content_title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he still wants to bring Fulham starlet Fabio Carvalho to Anfield
Contents: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he still wants to sign Fulham's Fabio Carvalho but that he "doesn't know" what will happen regarding another bid. The Reds came in for the 19-year-old during the January transfer window, but failed to get the deal over the line. Klopp also revealed star forwards Mo Salah and Sadio Mane may be available for Thursday's game with Leicester City after AFCON duty.

Content_title: Dani Alves sent off and scores as Barcelona beat Atletico Madrid and climb to fourth in La Liga
Contents: Nou Camp, La Liga - Barcelona 4 (Alba 10' Gavi 21' Araujo 43' Alves 49') Atletico Madrid 2 (Carrasco 8' Suarez 58')

Content_title: Liverpool ease past Cardiff as Harvey Elliott makes scoring return in FA Cup win
Contents: Anfield, FA Cup - Liverpool 3 (Jota 53’, Minamino 68’ Elliott 76’) Cardiff 1 (Colwill 80’)

Content_title: FA Cup: 'A really poor performance' - Leicester boss Brendan Rodgers apologises for defeat at Nottingham Forest
Contents: Leicester City lost 4-1 at Nottingham Forest in the FA Cup fourth round on Sunday night, continuing the side's poor form under Brendan Rodgers. The manager apologised for the result at the City Ground, and said the club needed to be ready for their next game, coming against Rodgers' former team Liverpool.

Content_title: Salomon Rondon double sees off Boreham Wood as Everton book FA Cup quarter-final meeting with Crystal Palace
Contents: FA Cup fifth round – Goodison Park – Everton 2 (Rondon 57’, 84’) Boreham Wood 0

Content_title: David Brooks diagnosed with Hodgkin Lymphoma, Bournemouth midfielder to undergo treatment in the next week
Contents: "This is a very difficult message for me to write,” Brooks wrote on Twitter. “I have been diagnosed with Stage II Hodgkin Lymphoma and will begin a course of treatment next week. Although this has come as a shock to myself and my family, the prognosis is a positive one and I am confident that I will make a full recovery and be back playing as soon as possible."

Content_title: Liverpool 2-0 Villarreal: Pervis Estupinan own goal, Sadio Mane give hosts advantage in Champions League semi-final
Contents: Champions League semi-final first leg, Anfield – Liverpool 2 (Estupinan OG 53’, Mane 55’) Villarreal 0

Content_title: Liverpool look absolutely unstoppable after Champions League victory over Villarreal - The Warm-Up
Contents: Villarreal came to Anfield to try and stop Liverpool playing, and they managed it. For almost an hour. But then the most inevitable side in Europe did what they always do, and Liverpool have one foot in the final. Over in Italy, the title may already have been decided by a truly magnificent mistake.

Content_title: 'The game is still alive' - Jordan Henderson warns against Liverpool complacency after win over Villarreal
Contents: Liverpool's captain Jordan Henderson was delighted with his side's display as they defeated their Spanish rivals Villarreal in the semi-finals of the Champions League on Wednesday night at Anfield. He praised his teammates' determination to find a breakthrough after they failed to score in an otherwise excellent first half.

Content_title: 'The best I've ever seen' - Rio Ferdinand, Michael Owen and Peter Crouch laud Liverpool after win over Villarreal
Contents: Former England internationals Rio Ferdinand, Michael Owen and Peter Crouch were unanimous in their verdict when it came to praising Liverpool following their victory over Villarreal at Anfield on Wednesday night in the Champions League. The three pundits described Jurgen Klopp's side as 'the best' they had ever seen play for the club.

Content_title: Mohamed Salah contract: Liverpool forward admits he does not know if he will sign a new deal with one year left
Contents: Mohamed Salah is not sure what his future holds. Salah has one year left on his current contract and although he is keen to remain at the Merseyside club, he has not been given a new deal yet. The two-time African Player of the Year is the Premier League's top scorer this season with 22 goals. Salah stresses that for him a new contract is not "everything about the money".

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp signs new deal to stay at Premier League club Liverpool as manager until 2026
Contents: Jurgen Klopp joined the Anfield giants Liverpool in 2015 and has led the club to success both domestically and in Europe during his tenure. With his existing deal set to expire in 2024, Klopp had hinted he might leave the club. However, with the club looking to make history as they chase a quadruple, the German will remain in the dugout for a further two years.

Content_title: Chelsea close to retaining the Women's Super League title after beating London rivals Tottenham 2-1 at Kingsmeadow
Contents: Beth England and Sam Kerr were on the scoresheet as Chelsea beat Tottenham for the second time in just five days to move a step closer to retaining their Women's Super League title. Spurs had fought their way back into the match at the end of the first half, but Chelsea responded within a minute to secure the victory which gave them breathing space at the top of the table ahead of Arsenal.

Content_title: Premier League result - Naby Keita grabs crucial goal to give Liverpool victory over Newcastle
Contents: Premier League, St James' Park - Newcastle 0 Liverpool 1 (Keita 19')

Content_title: Beauty without heartbreak - Real Madrid and Manchester City must play the same way next week in Champions League
Contents: While Real Madrid trail by a single goal after their 4-3 defeat to Manchester City in the Champions League semi-final first leg on Saturday night at The Etihad, it might be City who appoach the second leg with more fear. However after two remarkable sides took part in a wild and frenetic match, they should trust their talent and attempt the same again next week.

Content_title: 'Stop booing or you'll need more air' - Neymar responds to Paris Saint-Germain critics after clinching Ligue 1 title
Contents: Neymar has regularly been booed by Paris Saint-Germain supporters this season. But after the Ligue 1 club clinched their eighth league title in the last ten seasons, Neymar has responded at his critics and insists he is not leaving the club anytime soon. Kylian Mbappe was asked what he made of supporters who left before full-time. He replied: "Nobody spoils my pleasure."

Content_title: Real Madrid continue to battle Manchester City for Erling Haaland, Erik ten Hag keen on Frenkie de Jong  - Paper Round
Contents: Manchester City and Real Madrid are still keen on signing Borussia Dortmund's Erling Haaland, and Real also want Kylian Mbappe. Elsewhere, Leeds United are keen to get ahead of Liverpool in the race for Calvin Ramsay, and Manchester United may bring Frenkie de Jong to Old Trafford for new manager Erik ten Hag.

Content_title: Real Madrid v Chelsea: Time for Timo Werner to join stellar cast of unlikely lads in Champions League – The Warm-Up
Contents: Massimo Maccarone, Divock Origi, Timo Werner? European football has forged some unlikely heroes through the years and Chelsea could do with another emerging as they head to the Spanish capital bidding to flip a 3-1 deficit from the first leg in the Champions League. Elsewhere, the back-up Gareth Bale requested five years ago has finally arrived and there’s some sweet, sweet Maccarone content.

Content_title: Paul Pogba meets PSG director Leonardo for transfer talks, Wolves eye Ruben Neves replacement – Paper Round
Contents: Tuesday’s Paper Round leads on Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba, who is reportedly nearing a move to Paris Saint-Germain after holding talks in person with sporting director Leonardo. Elsewhere, Wolves are looking at potential replacements for Arsenal target Ruben Neves, Arsenal are interested in Alvaro Morata, and Newcastle are weighing up their transfer options on the wing.

Content_title: 'It's the mouth that kills the fish' - Diego Simeone silent in face of Pep Guardiola barbs ahead of Atletico v Man City
Contents: Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone chose to remain silent in the face of criticism of his methods ahead of his side's Champions League second leg against Manchester City. Neither would 'El Cholo' be drawn into attacking City boss Pep Guardiola and said that his side would take a similar tactical approach in Wednesday night's tie to their defensive first-leg display.

Content_title: Real Madrid are magic, it's the only explanation, after sneaking past Chelsea in Champions League - The Warm-Up
Contents: There is no logical or rational way to make sense of Real Madrid, or of that Luka Modric pass, so let's be honest: they're using magic. Strange and wonderful magic. Meanwhile Villarreal are doing their homework, and so, for once, are Manchester United – and that’s very good news for one forgotten man. Plus we celebrate the 20th anniversary of Bend It Like Beckham.

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp is right, of course Man City's match with Liverpool will not decide the Premier League title
Contents: Manchester City’s match with Liverpool on Sunday is being billed as a Premier League title decider, but Jurgen Klopp does not think that’s the case. Both teams will have seven matches remaining after the Etihad encounter, so of course the Liverpool boss is right, with plenty of obstacles in the way – from sides chasing European places, to exploits in other competitions.

Content_title: ‘We played a fantastic game’ – Pep Guardiola reflects on seven-goal thriller Champions League semi against Real Madrid
Contents: He said: “I told them to rest and said that Leeds is the most important thing now, before we travel to Madrid and try to win the game. “Both teams want to attack and have the quality to play. Football is a fantastic spectacle, it is a release. “That’s why I want to say congratulations to Carlo and his team because they are so good."

Content_title: Real Madrid, Barcelona and Juventus battle to sign free agent Paul Pogba upon Manchester United exit – Paper Round
Contents: Paul Pogba has the choice between three of Europe's finest clubs when his Manchester United contract expires and he becomes a free agent this summer. Elsewhere, Chelsea are planning to reignite their interest in Jules Kounde, Arsenal are ready to launch a £35 million bid for Gabriel Jesus and Newcastle United are linked with a £30 million move for Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.

Content_title: Mauricio Pochettino set to be removed from his role as Paris Saint-Germain manager - report
Contents: Mauricio Pochettino is set to be removed from his role as Paris Saint-Germain manager, according to a report in France. Pochettino and PSG won the Ligue 1 title on Saturday - the Argentine coach's first career league crown - but it seems that hasn't placated the club's Qatari hierarchy, who were known to be displeased by the painful Champions League exit to Real Madrid.

Content_title: Karim Benzema breaks Chelsea hearts as Real Madrid edge blockbuster in extra-time to reach semi-finals
Contents: Champions League quarter-final second leg, Bernabeu – Real Madrid 2 (Rodrygo 80’, Benzema 96’) Chelsea 3 (Mount 14’, Rudiger 50’, Werner 75’) Real Madrid win 5-4 on aggregate.

Content_title: Thomas Tuchel: Chelsea boss slams referee for ‘smiling and laughing loud’ with Real Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti
Contents: Chelsea had roared back from losing the first leg 3-1 to lead 4-3 on aggregate after goals from Mason Mount, Antonio Rudiger and Timo Werner in the Bernabeu. However they were ultimately undone, first by a brilliant finish from Rodrygo that forced extra time, then by Karim Benzema’s header that sent the holders crashing out. Thomas Tuchel was proud of his players – but was unhappy with the ref

Content_title: Chelsea showed fight at Real Madrid but their season goes down as a failure after Champions League exit
Contents: Chelsea were brilliant for 80 minutes, but that is not enough to win a football match at this level, and though it was flashes of brilliance from Benzema and Modric that ultimately helped Real Madrid reach the Champions League semis, Chelsea were made to pay for a lacklustre first leg and missed chances in Madrid. Under Thomas Tuchel, they’ll bounce back, but this season has not gone to plan.

Content_title: Tottenham manager Antonio Conte denies 'fake news' rumours linking him with a move to Paris Saint-Germain
Contents: With his side fighting for a top-four finish in the Premier League, Antonio Conte says it's unfair for his players to be distracted by "lies" suggesting he is interested in taking over at PSG - where former Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino is currently manager. Tottenham are two points behind their north London rivals Arsenal in the race for Champions League qualification.

Content_title: Defender William Saliba unclear of Arsenal future ahead of summer transfer talks - Paper Round
Contents: Marseille's on-loan defender William Saliba will discover his Arsenal future this summer, Tammy Abraham could be brought to Arsenal from Roma, while West Ham are considering a move for Everton's Michael Keane. Pablo Dybala could move from Juventus to fellow Serie A challengers, Inter Milan, on a free transfer.

Contents: Paulo Dybala is being made to feel unwelcome at Juventus with a contract that is set to run out in 2022, Mesut Ozil will not be allowed back into Arsenal's first team squad, Manchester United will let Brandon Williams get experience on loan in January, and Jayden Braaf is the latest Manchester City youngster keen to move on.

Content_title: Southampton’s Theo Walcott 'felt a lot of fear' in Arsenal during scoring return at old club
Contents: Theo Walcott said he could feel "fear" from out of form Arsenal, after returning to his old club to open the scoring for Southampton during a 1-1 draw in the Premier League. The result ended a three game losing streak for the Gunners and left Southampton third in the table, with the north Londonders 15th and closer to the relegation zone than the top four.

Content_title: Arsenal 1-1 Southampton: Mikel Arteta's side show spirit but lack of discipline needs fixing fast
Contents: For the third time in five matches Arsenal saw a man sent off. This isn't a case of trying to save a game in the dying minutes, these are needless reds happening with plenty of time left on the clock. Arsenal may have shown spirit but they have to address their recklessness, writes Mike Gibbons.

Contents: UEFA Europa League, Red Bull Arena: RB Leipzig 1 (Angelino 85’), Rangers 0

Contents: Quique Setien has been sacked as Barcelona head coach after just eight months in charge.

Contents: Chelsea are favourites to land RB Leipzig striker Timo Werner, according to multiple reports.

Contents: With Chelsea having signed Timo Werner, Pete Sharland looks deeper into what the transfer means for the club.

Content_title: Opinion: Everton manager Frank Lampard returns to Chelsea with questions hanging over his career
Contents: Everton manager Frank Lampard could soon be out of a job if he fails to keep the Premier League strugglers up at the end of the season. The former Chelsea midfielder and manager will face his former club this weekend and he could learn from Thomas Tuchel's performance at Stamford Bridge and wonder where to go next.

Content_title: This time Pep Guardiola the overthinker can’t help but tinker as Man City face Real Madrid – The Warm-Up
Contents: Manchester City meet Real Madrid in the first leg of their Champions League semi-final tonight, and are without one key defender and potentially two more. Elsewhere, Frank Lampard has some explaining to do, Leeds have some praying to do, and Tyler Dibling does what Tyler Dibling does best – it would seem.

Content_title: Frank Lampard slams referee Stuart Attwell for not giving his Everton side a penalty in the Merseyside derby
Contents: Everton boss Frank Lampard slammed referee Stuart Attwell for his performance in the Merseyside derby against Liverpool at Anfield. Lampard was particularly incensed that youngster Anthony Gordon was booked for diving, and then not given a penalty when he appeared to be trodden on by Joel Matip with the score at 0-0 in the second half. Liverpool scored not long after before going on to win 2-0.

Content_title: Women's Super League: Khadija Shaw scores four as Manchester City thrash Brighton and move into third
Contents: Manchester City have leapfrogged rivals Manchester United into third courtesy of a 7-2 win over Brighton, with Khadija Shaw scoring four, as the Women's Super League enters its final week of the season. Caroline Weir, Alex Greenwood and Lauren Hemp were also on the scoresheet for Gareth Taylor's side.

Contents: Serie A, San Siro: AC Milan 1 (Leao 82’), Fiorentina 0

Content_title: Arsenal and Chelsea both record wins as Women's Super League title race looks like going to the wire
Contents: Arsenal coasted past struggling Everton to continue their neck-and-neck tussle for the title with Chelsea. Goals from Caitlin Foord, Beth Mead and Jordan Nobbs got the Gunners their win. Earlier, Chelsea had beaten Spurs at the Hive despite going behind, and then having keeper Ann-Katrin Berger sent off. But Emma Hayes' side scored twice in the second half to ease away from their dogged opponents.

Content_title: Will Jurgen Klopp usurp Pep Guardiola as the world's best coach if he wins the 2022 Champions League?
Contents: Pep Guardiola is widely regarded as the best coach in the world, but since leaving Barcelona he has failed to win a single Champions League trophy. While that could change this season, it could also see Jurgen Klopp lift the cup with Liverpool for the second time. If that happens then comparisons can be made between the two managers.

Content_title: Ralf Rangnick considers turning to youth with Harry Maguire, Jadon Sancho out for Manchester United against Chelsea
Contents: Manchester United's top-four hopes could be over with a defeat to Chelsea on Thursday, and they will be without two key players for the match in Harry Maguire and Jadon Sancho. Maguire is out with a knee injury and Sancho has tonsillitis. Ralf Rangnick's side are sixth in the Premier League table, six points behind fourth-placed Arsenal and having played a game more.

Content_title: Antonio Rudiger ‘agrees four-year Real Madrid contract’ after Thomas Tuchel says Chelsea’s ‘hands tied’ over renewal
Contents: Antonio Rudiger is Real Madrid bound, according to the latest reports, with the German defender set to join as a free agent in the summer and sign a four-year contract with the club, who are on the verge of winning La Liga. Real are prepared to give Rudiger more money than Chelsea, whose “hands were tied” over enticing the centre-back with a better offer due to sanctions, Thomas Tuchel said.
